intro: Echinocodonia, commonly known as the spiny codon, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its branched stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The flowers are typically small and clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of the carrot family. Echinocodonia species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. These plants are often found in rocky or disturbed soils and are valued for their ornamental qualities.
